metadata.Title: CVE-2023-48795 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Prefix truncation attack on BPP: By manipulating sequence numbers duringthe handshake, an attacker can remove the initial messages on the securechannel without causing a MAC failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-48795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh-4 - 0.9.3-2ubuntu2.4
libssh-gcrypt-4 - 0.9.3-2ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

libssh2-1 - 1.8.0-2.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in fips-updates/focal is affected and may need fixing.
dropbear package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
golang-go.crypto package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
snapd package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
libssh package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.3-2ubuntu2.4').
libssh2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.0-2.1ubuntu0.1').
openssh-ssh1 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
paramiko package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
putty package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
proftpd-dfsg package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
python-asyncssh package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
